prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The latest lawyer to join our agency. She lived in Europe for a time, where she studied psychology.
Character 1
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: The head of our office. He was retired once, but made his return to the legal world a few months ago.
Character 2
Name: Apollo Justice
Description: The lawyer at my agency who was attacked during the court bombing trial. He's currently recovering at the hospital.
Character 3
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: An aspiring magician who Mr. Wright adopted when duty called.
Character 4
Name: Clay Terran
Description: The victim in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a close friend of mine.
Character 5
Name: Juniper Woods
Description: Athena's childhood friend. Talented singer and Student Council President, she is studying to be a judge.
Character 6
Name: Solomon Starbuck
Description: The defendant in this case. He was a HAT-2 crew member and a mentor to the victim.
Character 7
Name: Simon Blackquill
Description: A prosecutor and prison inmate. He can manipulate witnesses through the power of suggestion.
Character 8
Name: Bobby Fulbright
Description: The detective assigned to this case. He led the evacuation effort at the Space Center after the bombing incident.
Character 9
Name: Candice Arme
Description: A detective who specialized in bomb cases. Was on detail at the Space Center. One of the first to find the body.
Character 10
Name: Yuri Cosmos
Description: The director of the Space Center and one of the first people to discover the body. He seems exceedingly full of himself.
Character 11
Name: Ponco
Description: A guide robot at the Space Center. She can provide information on the Center and show people around.
Character 12
Name: Aura Blackquill
Description: A researcher who's developing robots at the Space Center. She is Prosecutor Blackquill's older sister.
Character 13
Name: Clonco
Description: One of the robots developed by Aura, who refers to him as "Hunk of Junk".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My cherished attorney's badge. Just putting it on makes me feel... ready.* (when playing as Apollo Justice) It's my all-important badge. Proof of my profession.* (when playing as Phoenix Wright)
Evidence 1
Name: Terran's Autopsy Report
Description: Cause of death: Stabbing. The victim was discovered in the third-floor boarding lounge in the main building.
Evidence 2
Name: Space Center Diagram
Description: A cross-section view of the main building of the Space Center and Launch Pad 1.
Evidence 3
Name: Utility Knife
Description: The victim's blood was found on its blade, but no fingerprints could be lifted. It has the victim's blood on it. From a set of utility tools used by Space Center techs.
Evidence 4
Name: Bombing Report
Description: The explosions sparked a fire on the second floor of the main building and the middle level of the launch pad near the elevator.
Evidence 5
Name: Evacuation Report
Description: The bombs went off despite tight security. Police officers and riot police who had been standing by gave the evacuation instructions.
Evidence 6
Name: Launch Pad 1 Door Lock
Description: A biometric door lock operated by fingerprint recognition. Only the defendant, the victim, and the Space Center director had access. Starbuck's prints were found on this door lock. Also see photo taken after the incident. (2 pages.)
Evidence 7
Name: Security Camera Video
Description: Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor to the boarding lounge. Video showing the defendant and victim's escape from the corridor. The video ends immediately after this scene.
Evidence 8
Name: Oxygen Tank Data
Description: The victim's tank was ruptured, with 0% left. The defendant's had 80%. Remaining oxygen is displayed on left shoulder. The victim's oxygen tank was struck by a bullet.
Evidence 9
Name: Space Center Pamphlet
Description: A pamphlet for visitors to the Space Center. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge. It includes a diagram of the boarding lounge and a cross-section view of the Space Center. (3 pages.)
Evidence 10
Name: Bullet Hole
Description: A single bullet hole was found in the boarding lounge. The bullet itself is missing. The only bullet hole found in the boarding lounge. It was made by a bullet fired from a .38-caliber gun.
Evidence 11
Name: Control Room Door Lock
Description: The door lock to the east. It can only be operated by the director. Backup power lets it function even when the power goes out.
Evidence 12
Name: Bullet
Description: Discovered in a gutter that runs along the south wall of the boarding lounge. It was fired from a .10 caliber handgun.
Evidence 13
Name: "Hope" Capsule
Description: Found in the victim's possession. It recently returned from a seven-year mission and contains asteroid samples.
Evidence 14
Name: Aura's Statement
Description: The perp held a lighter with an Earth emblem on it in their left hand, and a knife in their right.
Evidence 15
Name: Bullet from Arme's Gun
Description: The bullet found near the victim's oxygen tank. It was fired from a .38 caliber handgun.
Evidence 16
Name: Lighter
Description: The lighter found on the floor of the Space Museum. The true culprit's fingerprints are on it in the victim's blood. Evidence found by Detective Fulbright. It has Athena's prints on it in the victim's blood.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: All I did was support Clay over my shoulder and get us out of the rocket!
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 1
Testimony: Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor.
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 2
Testimony: Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate.
Person: Starbuck
Testimony 3
Testimony: I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!
Person: Starbuck

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem step by step. First, I need to understand what's being asked. The user wants me to find a pair of evidence and testimony that contradict each other in the provided case. I have to choose only one pair and present the answer in the specified JSON format.

Looking at the characters, evidences, and testimonies provided, I'll start by going through each testimony and see if there's an evidence that directly contradicts it. 

The defendant here is Solomon Starbuck, and his testimonies are Testimonies 0 to 3. Let's look at each of his testimonies and see which evidence might conflict with them.

Testimony 0: "All I did was support Clay over my shoulder and get us out of the rocket!"  
Testimony 1: "Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor."  
Testimony 2: "Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate."  
Testimony 3: "I didn't kill Clay! I was trying to save him!"  

Looking at the evidence list, Evidence 8 (Oxygen Tank Data) states that the victim's oxygen tank was ruptured by a bullet, while the defendant's had 80% remaining. The bullet hole (Evidence 10) is from a .38-caliber gun, and Evidence 15 is a bullet from Arme's gun of the same caliber found near the victim's tank. 

If Starbuck claims he was trying to save Clay and didn't kill him, but the oxygen tank was shot with a bullet (which caused the rupture), that suggests someone fired at the tank. If the defendant had access to a gun and the bullet was found near the tank, that could contradict his claim of innocence. However, the testimony specifically says he didn't kill Clay, so maybe the contradiction is elsewhere.

Looking at Evidence 7 (Security Camera Video), it shows the defendant and victim escaping to the boarding lounge, but the video ends there. If the murder happened after that, maybe the video doesn't cover the time of the stabbing. But the autopsy (Evidence 1) says cause of death was stabbing, so the bullet might not be the direct cause. Wait, the autopsy mentions stabbing, but the oxygen tank's rupture was from a bullet. Maybe the stabbing was separate.

Wait, the victim's cause of death is stabbing (Evidence 1), so the bullet in the oxygen tank might be a separate issue. The defendant's testimony says he was trying to save Clay, but if he had a bullet in his possession or if the bullet was linked to him, that could conflict. However, Evidence 16 is a lighter with Athena's prints in blood, which might not be directly related.

Another angle: Evidence 6 (Launch Pad 1 Door Lock) says only the defendant, victim, and director had access. If Starbuck was the last one there, but his testimony says he was with Clay, maybe there's a contradiction there. Or if the door lock was used by someone else.

Wait, Testimony 1 says he took the elevator to the middle level (Launch Pad 1's middle level, as per Evidence 2's diagram). But Evidence 4 (Bombing Report) mentions explosions on the second floor and middle level. If the elevator was in an area that exploded, maybe he couldn't have taken that route, but that's speculative.

Looking at Evidence 12: a bullet found in a gutter from a .10 caliber gun. But the bullet in the oxygen tank (Evidence 15) is .38. Maybe the caliber discrepancy could be a point. However, the testimonies don't mention bullets directly.

Wait, the key contradiction might be between Testimony 2 ("Clay had passed out by the time we got the order to evacuate") and Evidence 8 (Oxygen Tank Data). If Clay's oxygen tank was shot and he was already passed out, perhaps the bullet was fired while he was unconscious, which would align with the testimony. But maybe the timing or the presence of the bullet suggests someone else was there. Alternatively, if the defendant had to carry Clay but also had to fire the bullet, that could be conflicting, but that's not direct evidence.

Alternatively, looking at Evidence 14 (Aura's Statement), which mentions a lighter with Earth emblem and a knife. If the lighter's fingerprints are on it (Evidence 16 has Athena's prints), but the testimony says Starbuck didn't kill him, but if the lighter is linked to the perpetrator, maybe that's a contradiction. But the lighter's fingerprints are Athena's, not Starbuck's. So that might not directly contradict his testimony.

Hmm. Let me check Testimony 1 again: "Like always, I took the elevator down to the middle level and headed for the corridor." The Space Center Diagram (Evidence 2) shows the main building and Launch Pad 1. The middle level of the launch pad is where the explosion happened (Evidence 4). If the elevator was in that area, maybe taking the elevator there during the explosion would be impossible, but the testimony says he did so before the bombs went off. Wait, the Evacuation Report (Evidence 5) says bombs went off despite security. The timing matters. If the bombs detonated during the evacuation, then taking the elevator before the blast would be possible. But maybe the elevator was in a damaged area, making his path impossible. Not sure.

Wait, Testimony 1 says he took the elevator to the middle level (Launch Pad 1's middle level) and headed for the corridor. But Evidence 4's bombing report says the middle level of the launch pad had explosions. If the elevator was in that area, maybe he couldn't have taken it because it was already damaged. However, the bombs went off despite security, so maybe they were set to explode after he was there. But without exact timing, this is unclear.

Another angle: The Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) shows them escaping to the boarding lounge, but the video ends there. The stabbing happened in the boarding lounge (per Autopsy Report, victim found there). So if the video ends when they entered the boarding lounge, maybe the stabbing occurred after, but Starbuck's testimony says he was trying to save Clay. If the video doesn't show the stabbing, but he was there, maybe his alibi is broken, but that's not a direct contradiction. 

Wait, the key contradiction might be between Testimony 3 ("I didn't kill Clay") and the evidence that the defendant's prints are on the door lock (Evidence 6). The door lock only allows access to defendant, victim, and director. If the murder happened in an area only accessible via that door, and Starbuck had access, but he claims he didn't do it, that doesn't contradict directly. However, if the autopsy shows the stabbing occurred in a place only he could access, but that's not clear from the evidence descriptions.

Alternatively, the bullet in the oxygen tank (Evidence 15) was fired from Arme's gun, but if Starbuck had access to that gun, but he says he didn't kill him, that could conflict. But the testimony doesn't mention the bullet, so maybe not.

Alternatively, the evacuation started after the bombs went off (Evidence 5: "bombs went off despite tight security. Police... gave evacuation instructions"). So he couldn't have taken the elevator to the middle level after the bombs exploded. Alternatively, the explosion occurred in the middle level, so the elevator was inoperable during his journey. But he says he took it, which would be impossible if it was already destroyed. That would be a contradiction. 

So, Testimony 1 says he took the elevator to the middle level (Launch Pad 1's middle level), but Evidence 4 says explosions occurred there. If the elevator was part of that area and destroyed, he couldn't have taken it. Hence, contradiction between Testimony 1 and Evidence 4.

Thus, the answer would be {"evidence":4, "testimony":1}.
</think>

cot:
Okay, let me try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other here. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies related to a murder case. The task is to find one pair where an evidence contradicts a testimony.

First, I need to go through each testimony and see which evidence might conflict with it. Let's look at the testimonies from Solomon Starbuck, the defendant. 

Testimony 0 says he initially made a mistake about his escape route. Testimony 1 corrects it, saying he took a different route, maybe from the upper level. Testimony 2 specifically mentions that he went down from the upper level with the capsule and Clay.

Now, looking at the evidences, Evidence 7 is the Security Camera Video. Its description says it shows the defendant and victim escaping from the corridor to the boarding lounge, and the video ends there. The key point here is that the video only shows them moving from the corridor to the boarding lounge, which is probably on the third floor as per the Autopsy Report (Evidence 1). 

If Starbuck's testimony (Testimony 2) claims he came down from the upper level (which would be the third floor or higher), but the Security Camera Video (Evidence 7) only shows them moving to the boarding lounge (third floor) and doesn't show them coming down from a higher level, that could be a contradiction. Wait, the upper level might refer to the launch pad's upper parts. Let me check the Space Center Diagram (Evidence 2) which mentions Launch Pad 1. The Bombing Report (Evidence 4) mentions explosions on the second floor and middle level of the launch pad near the elevator. 

If the Security Camera Video only captures their movement to the boarding lounge (third floor main building), but Starbuck claims he came down from the upper level (maybe the launch pad's upper level), then the video doesn't show that path. So the testimony about taking a different route from the upper level isn't supported by the video evidence, implying contradiction. 

Alternatively, maybe the boarding lounge is on the third floor, so if he was already there, he couldn't have come down from a higher upper level. The diagram might clarify, but since I can't see it, relying on descriptions: The autopsy says the victim was found in the third-floor boarding lounge. The Security Camera Video shows them escaping to that lounge. If Starbuck says he came down from the upper level (higher than third floor?), but the lounge is the third floor, then his testimony about the route contradicts the video which ends at the boarding lounge. 

Therefore, Evidence 7 (Security Camera Video) shows their path ending at the boarding lounge, while Testimony 2 claims they came down from the upper level (which might be higher than where the video ends). That's a contradiction because the video doesn't show them coming from above, only arriving there. So the answer would be Evidence 7 and Testimony 2.
</think>
